_header: O blessed Lord my Lord O Christ Jesu
Subjects: Christ, fifteen O’s; fifteen, O’s of Christ
_description: Lydgate’s ‘Fifteen O’s of Christ’ — forty-two 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
O blyssed lord my lord & Cryst IhesuWelle and hed spryng of
                    eternal swetnesse…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…And by thy modrys meek medyacyounthe charter asselid whan
                    þu heeng on þe Rood
BodLauMis683.Attributed Author:
… translatyd out of latyn in to Englyssh by damp Iohn Lydgate monk
                    of seynt Edmundys Bury (f. 1); Explicit Quod John Lydgate (f. 8)
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title:
HEre begynnyth the xv Oys translatyd out of latyn in to Englyssh by damp
                    Iohn Lydgate monk of seynt Edmundys Bury (f. 1)
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 238-50.

BodRawC48.First Lines:
O Bissid lord my lord o Ihesu cristWelle and hedspryng of eternall
                    swetnesse…
BodRawC48.Last Lines:
…And bi thi moodris meeke meditaciounThe chartir assalyd whan
                    thow heng on þe roode

CamJes56.First Lines:
[B]lissid lorde my lorde O Ihesu cristWell and hede spring of
                    eternall swetnes…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…And by þi moders meeke mediacionThe charter asselid whan
                    þu hing on the Roode
CamJes56.Attributed Title:
Incipit quindecim OO (f. 65v); O Ihesu criste eterna
                        dulcedo te (left margin, f. 65v)

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
…Ihesu called a lylye and Oooure lyfe oure vertue supporte yn
                    owr nedethynke & recorde & remembre alsoffrom hede to fote
                    howeþu didest blede…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…& by thy moder ys meditacionþe charyte enseled whan
                    þu hanged on þe rode
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
Here endythe þe fyftene ooes drawen oute of engelishe latyn
                    vnto engelishe by lidgate (f. 288).

BLHar2255.First Lines:
O Blyssid lord my lord O crist ihuWelle and hedspryng of eternal
                    swetnesse…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…Graunt of my synnes ful remyssiounWhich for our sake starff
                    vpon the Rood
